Werkzeug

The Swiss Army Knife For Python Web Developers

Documentation Overview

Table of Contents

  • Reference
  • General Development Information

Welcome to the Werkzeug documentation.

Reference

Documentation regarding the Werkzeug modules:

  • Installing Werkzeug
  • Important Terms — read this before reading the documentation
  • Tutorial — getting started with Werkzeug
  • Unicode — short introduction into unicode in python and how Werkzeug encodes and decodes data.
  • Wrappers — request and response objects
  • Routing System — a powerful URL dispatcher and builder
  • Mini Templates — a minimal templating system
  • Management Script Utilities — tools to write simple management scripts
  • Test Utilities — unittest support tools
  • HTTP Exceptions — exceptions for HTTP
  • Utilities — useful classes and functions
  • Context Locals — a WSGI centric version of thread.local.
  • Debugging System — an interactive debugger.
  • Serving Applications — serving WSGI applications.
  • API Stability — API stability

General Development Information

This part of the documentation mainly explains how to develop WSGI applications. This is also interesting if you don’t want to use Werkzeug but other WSGI utilities; the ideas are the same.

  • How WSGI Works — short introduction to WSGI and Werkzeug.
  • Organizing Code — gives you an idea how you can organize your code when using Werkzeug.
  • Other Libraries — links to other libraries you can use with Werkzeug.
  • Reusable Applications — how to develop modular applications with reusable bits.
  • Deploying WSGI Applications — ready for production? This page covers all the details you have to know to deploy your application on various webservers.
Werkzeug is a Pocoo project licensed under the BSD license.
